physical_examinations.relevant_findings: On examination, Twin A appeared fatigued and diaphoretic; she cried weakly in response to painful stimuli. Mild intercostal and thoracoabdominal retractions were present, and scattered rhonchi were present throughout both lungs on auscultation.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Eleven days after the initial evaluation, Twin A developed cough and rhinorrhea. After a few days, she appeared tired and had diminished oral intake and bluish discoloration of the nail beds.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Temperature: 36.7°C; Pulse: 102 bpm; Blood Pressure: 107/74 mmHg; Respiratory Rate: 51 breaths/min; Oxygen saturation: 32%.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Upon examination, copious nasal secretions were present; her cough was weak, and she was unable to clear the secretions. Tachypnea and retractions were present, and breath sounds were coarse bilaterally with scattered rhonchi.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: During her stay in the pediatric intensive care unit, episodes of oxygen saturation measurements in Twin A's arm fell to between 30% and 40%, but the saturation in her leg fluctuated between 70% and 80%.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Her parents observed that Twin A appeared tired, was less active than usual, and had diminished oral intake.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After the initial evaluation, Twin A had recurrent respiratory distress, and her oxygen saturation severely declined during episodes of agitation.
